Posted By: Nickajack (6/20/2011 1:25:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Banned in our EDH playgroup. For the type of EDH games that I prefer, skullclamp's costs are too little for the awesomeness it does. Even with one copy, its still too easy to break. There can only be one copy, sure, but there can be plenty of tutor and recur effects in EDH. Sure you could counter-exile or shatter-exile it, or remove it from the graveyard, but it still just feels too powerful. And skullclamp+ grave pact? Disgusting. Note: we ban gravepact too. As well as [spell crumple](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spell crumple)...  
 Whether your group plays with skullclamp or other similarly uber-potent cards really depends on how you see EDH. If you see it as a new format to build new ridiculously powerful decks that synergize with a general's abilities, by all means, play the clamp. If you see EDH as a somewhat slower paced format which allows for a wide variety of cards to flourish, then my feeling is that skullclamp is probably a bad idea.
posts.html:

Sure you could counter-exile or shatter-exile it, or remove it from the graveyard, but it still just feels too powerful. And skullclamp+ grave pact? Disgusting. Note: we ban gravepact too. As well as spell crumple...

If you see it as a new format to build new ridiculously powerful decks that synergize with a general's abilities, by all means, play the clamp. If you see EDH as a somewhat slower paced format which allows for a wide variety of cards to flourish, then my feeling is that skullclamp is probably a bad idea.

Posted By: raptorman333 (4/26/2013 7:38:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Works well in a lot of different decks. Obviously broken in the formats it's banned it but, in edh, I don't think it's really insane in anything but token decks or decks with a lot of 1 toughness utility/value creatures like [eternal witness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=eternal witness) and [wood elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wood elves). That being said, it's still very good in commander and worth consideration even in 5 Color because it really is that good. Also there are some fairly funny shenanigans you can pull off with cards like [Rotting Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rotting Rats). In all honesty though this card was a MAJOR mistake in terms of design.  
  
5/5 for power  
0/5 for design
posts.html:
